Posts.Content: cbr wrote: Never seems to fail....1 year post mastectomy w/reconstruciton.  Level 1 lymph node dissection.  Have now developed moderate - severe problems with carpel tunnel and nerve compression in elbow - nerve damage.  All doc's recommending surgery.  Of course, this is on the mastectomy side.  Trying to decide between the nerve damage and loosing the use of my hand or the risk of developing lymphedema.......Please, please any info out there on this???  Trying to decide.  If no surgery, nerve damage could become worse and permanent.  Surgery runs the risk of lymphedema.......Just don't know what to do.  If the whole cancer thing wasn't bad enough...Thanks in advance for any advice...........Surgeon says that he can do it without a tournaquet but would be more difficult and greater blood loss........
